moves.1. e4 c5: I like to play the Sicilian Defence when I'm black
moves.2. Bc4 g6 3. Qf3: Does he really think I will fall for this one?
moves.3... e6 4. Nc3 Nc6 5. Nge2: he's ready to castle and I still have to move out 2 peices before I can
moves.5... a6: I feared he would play Bb5 and double my pawns on the C file
moves.6. a3 Nf6: Time is wasting... prepare to castle
moves.7. d3: Is he preparing to castle queen-side?
moves.8. Bg5: a little late to try to pin my knight
moves.9. O-O: and I was sure he was going queen-side!
moves.10... Qc7: I still wonder if d6 or NxBc4 would have been better...
moves.12. Ba2 Bb7: trying to gain total control of the queen-side
moves.13. Nce2 d5: My attempt to take control of the center also
moves.14. exd5 exd5: the center is opening... I should have moved a rook to the d or e file
moves.15. d4: I'm not sure what he was thinkiing here, but the move is premature
moves.15... Nc4 16. Rfd1: he hands me a pawn... who am I to pass it up?
moves.16... Nxb2 17. Rd2: There are better squares for the rook
moves.18. Qb3: he saves his queen, so I'll trade a rook for my knight
moves.18... Nxd2 19. Qxb2 Ne4: protects my remaing knight and attacks the undefended bishop
moves.20. Nh3 Nxg5: I'm up on points, so I'll trade to eliminate the bishop pair
moves.22. Nf3: only one knight could be saved
moves.22... Qxe2 23. Re1: my queen appears to be trapped, so attack his queen is my only response
moves.24... Bxf2+: another pawn without good protection, causing the rook to fall prey to a bishop fork
moves.25. Kh1 Bxe1 26. Nxe1: definitely should have taken the bishop with the queen, now Qf1 is mate
moves.26... Rfe8: oops! I didn't see it! I must have been drinking again!!!
moves.27. Nf3 d4: an attack on the knight, pinned because if it moves Qxg2 mate
moves.28. Qg5: don't know why he didn't stop at f4, protecting the knight and  threating Qxf7
moves.29. gxf3:
it's all over now, but there was no other defense (29. Bd5 Qe1 or Qf1 mate
)
